result.markdown:
--- title: "Cluster long time series, scaled" author: Raphael Saldanha date: now --- This notebook aims to cluster the Brazilian municipalities considering dengue cases time-series similarities. ## Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.2 ✔ readr 2.1.4 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 ✔ ggplot2 3.4.2 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.2 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 ✔ purrr 1.0.1 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(lubridate) library(arrow) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'arrow' The following object is masked from 'package:lubridate': duration The following object is masked from 'package:utils': timestamp ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(timetk) library(dtwclust) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Loading required package: proxy Attaching package: 'proxy' The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': as.dist, dist The following object is masked from 'package:base': as.matrix Loading required package: dtw Loaded dtw v1.23-1. See ?dtw for help, citation("dtw") for use in publication. dtwclust: Setting random number generator to L'Ecuyer-CMRG (see RNGkind()). To read the included vignettes type: browseVignettes("dtwclust"). See news(package = "dtwclust") after package updates. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(kableExtra) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'kableExtra' The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(tictoc) ``` ::: ## Load data Load the aggregated data. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dengue <- read_parquet("../dengue-data/parquet_aggregated/dengue_md.parquet") dim(dengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 16772737 3 ``` ::: ::: ### Prepare data The chunk bellow executes various steps to prepare the data for clustering. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tdengue <- dengue %>% # Filter out dates after 2020-01-01, as this year is not complete filter(date <= as.Date("2020-01-01")) %>% # Pad days with zero cases group_by(mun) %>% pad_by_time(date, .by = "day", .pad_value = 0, .start_date = min(dengue$date), .end_date = max(dengue$date)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Aggregate by week mutate(date = floor_date(date, "week")) %>% group_by(mun, date) %>% summarise(freq = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Keep only municipalities series with more than 100 cases total group_by(mun) %>% mutate(total = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% filter(total >= 100) %>% select(-total) %>% # Scale cases by mun group_by(mun) %>% arrange(date) %>% mutate(freq = scale(freq)) %>% ungroup() %>% arrange(mun, date) %>% # Prepare time series mutate(mun = paste0("m_", mun)) %>% arrange(mun, date) %>% pivot_wider(names_from = mun, values_from = freq) %>% select(-date) %>% t() %>% tslist() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'mun'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ::: ## Clustering Sequence of `k` groups to be used. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} k_seq <- 3:10 ``` ::: ### SBD method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tic() clust <- tsclust( series = tdengue, type = "partitional", k = k_seq, distance = "sbd", seed = 13 ) toc() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 30.217 sec elapsed ``` ::: ::: ### Cluster Validity Indices (CVI) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(clust) <- paste0("k_", k_seq) res_cvi <- sapply(clust, cvi, type = "internal") %>% t() %>% as_tibble(rownames = "k") %>% arrange(-Sil) res_cvi %>% kbl() %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
k Sil SF CH DB DBstar D COP
k_3 0.1361517 0.3215523 301.2210 3.692051 4.316082 0.0679378 0.4052902
k_5 0.0868020 0.2224752 282.4503 2.413023 2.847291 0.0280136 0.3615501
k_6 0.0733088 0.1578847 154.6699 4.988996 6.309369 0.0216979 0.3660083
k_4 0.0610827 0.2544475 140.5981 6.897833 8.287407 0.0216420 0.3886784
k_9 0.0504672 0.0626711 124.3538 3.532466 4.849390 0.0248858 0.3501298
k_10 0.0466939 0.0628349 166.6916 3.820877 4.682205 0.0135861 0.3434336
k_8 0.0408157 0.1107509 164.5684 3.780052 4.964673 0.0221248 0.3432409
k_7 0.0380647 0.1346238 171.9309 4.240165 5.555059 0.0219174 0.3537959
````` ::: ::: ### Cluster with higher Silhouette statistic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sel_clust <- clust[[res_cvi[[1,1]]]] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_scaled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust, type = "centroids", lty = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_scaled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
